message: They would be put into GIANT sea pens. Those are nets built right into the water. They can see and hear other orcas. They can be taught to hunt. If they seem like they get it, they could be released, but probably not unless they go with their mothers to their mother's pod. Their dorsal fins will never stand up agian because the smallness and warmth of the pools cause the cartilage in their dorsal fins to break down, resulting in it flopping over, but they can survive that way - just not navigate so well.
